result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Attorney Fred Richardson
Received and Filed: Attorney Theodore Kafkas

Defendant Terry Long Fowler not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Terry Long Fowler.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Kafkas has been appointed.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Theodore Kafkas

Defendant Terry Long Fowler not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to be monitored by drug testing. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Terry Long Fowler appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Terry Long Fowler.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
